subject: Law
title: Copyright Basics
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Copyright Basics.

hook.text: The moment you write a poem, you own its copyright. No registration needed. Creation itself is enough.

buildup.text: Copyright protects original works of authorship: books, music, films, software, and art.

discovery.text: It gives the creator exclusive rights to reproduce, distribute, perform, and make derivative works.

twist.text: Copyright protects expression, not ideas. Two people can write different books about the same topic without conflict.

climax.text: For works created after 1978, copyright lasts the author's life plus 70 years. Corporate works get 95 years.

punchline.text: Create it and it's yours. That's copyright's promise.
